questions.question: ………………………… she saw us, she rushed towards us.
questions.description: Either could be used here with slightly different meanings.

questions.question: ……………………….. I had invited all of them, none of them turned up.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: She earns a lot of money ………………………., she spends hardly anything.
questions.description: However is not a conjunction it is a transitional adverb.

questions.question: ………………………….. they are poor, they cannot afford to buy a home.
questions.description: All of these words are used to give the reason for something.

questions.question: The postman came ………………………. I was mowing the lawn.
……………………….. she put in her best efforts, she could not succeed.
questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas even if refers to future.

questions.question: ………………………….. I had warned him, he didn’t listen to me.
………………………….. you work hard enough, you will succeed.
questions.description: Either could be used here with different meanings if expresses a condition as gives the reason.

questions.question: ………………………….. she has a university degree, she is unemployed.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: She was upset ……………………………. she had failed the test.
Hardly had I reached the station ……………………….. the train left.
…………………………. she was hungry, she refused to eat anything.
